did.unittitle: American Friends of Russian Freedom Records
did.abstract: The American Friends of Russian Freedom was founded in 1891 in Boston, Massachusetts. The organization supported the Russian opposition movement, broadly defined. The American Friends of Russian Freedom Records consists of letters, clippings and pamphlets pertaining to the American Friends of Russian Freedom, and specifically the organization's opposition to the 1893 Russian Extradition Treaty.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Albert Boni in 1964. The accession number associated with this collection is 2011.003.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The American Friends of Russian Freedom was founded in 1891 in Boston, Massachusetts. The organization supported the Russian opposition movement, broadly defined. A major campaign of the American Friends of Russian Freedom was to oppose the U.S. ratification of the Russian Expedition Treaty, which allowed Russians residing in the U.S. to be extradited to face political charges in Russia.

userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1891-1896, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.
